Returns: a string representation of the object.
toString().Description: Returns a string representation of the object. In general, the toString method returns a string that "textually represents" this object. The result should be a concise but informative representation that is easy for a person to read. It is recommended that all subclasses override this method. The toString method for class Object returns a string consisting of the name of the class of which the object is an instance, the at-sign character `@', and the unsigned hexadecimal representation of the hash code of the object. In other words, this method returns a string equal to the value of:

getMediaId().Description: Returns the media id in the @B_android#support#v4#media#MediaDescriptionCompat_E@ for this item.

getFlags().Description: Gets the flags of the item.

getDescription().Description: Returns the description of the media.

isBrowsable().Description: Returns whether this item is browsable.

Returns: An equivalent @B_android#support#v4#media#MediaBrowserCompat#MediaItem_E@ object, or null if none.
fromMediaItem(java.lang.Object).Description: Creates an instance from a framework https:##developer#android#com@B_android#media#browse#MediaBrowser#MediaItem_E@ object. This method is only supported on API 21+. On API 20 and below, it returns null.

Parameters: Parcel: The Parcel in which the object should be written.
int: Additional flags about how the object should be written. May be 0 or @B_android#os#Parcelable#PARCELABLE_WRITE_RETURN_VALUE_E@.
writeToParcel(android.os.Parcel, int).Description: Flatten this object in to a Parcel.

Returns: An equivalent list of @B_android#support#v4#media#MediaBrowserCompat#MediaItem_E@ objects, or null if none.
fromMediaItemList(java.util.List<?>).Description: Creates a list of @B_android#support#v4#media#MediaBrowserCompat#MediaItem_E@ objects from a framework https:##developer#android#com@B_android#media#browse#MediaBrowser#MediaItem_E@ object list. This method is only supported on API 21+. On API 20 and below, it returns null.

Parameters: MediaDescriptionCompat: The description of the media, which must include a media id.
int: The flags for this item.
MediaBrowserCompat.MediaItem(android.sup.Description: Create a new MediaItem for use in browsing media.

writeToParcel(android.os.Parcel,int).FullName: public void writeToParcel (Parcel out, int flags)

isPlayable().Description: Returns whether this item is playable.

ClassDesc: A class with information on a single media item for use in browsing/searching media. MediaItems are application dependent so we cannot guarantee that they contain the right values.
